Instruction: Heat your oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (175 degrees Celsius) and prepare a shallow baking dish by coating it with nonstick cooking spray.

Mix flour, Parmesan, paprika, salt, and pepper in a bowl. In a separate bowl, whisk together the egg and milk. Dip the chicken in the egg, then coat with the flour mixture. Transfer coated chicken to the prepared baking dish, and drizzle melted butter over the top.
Bake in the preheated oven for approximately 1 hour and 15 minutes until the cheese is golden brown and the chicken is thoroughly cooked.
